channel.title: Playing Own Server - Port Issue
channel.description:
I'm having trouble running my own server because no matter what I do it seems that I can't start the server on the Moparscape client and run it off the cmd file at the same time. The order doesn't seem to matter; whichever one I do second tells me that port 43594 is already occupied. I checked and am absolutely sure that it's not some other program using the port.
I did a lot of searching and couldn't find anything pertaining to this. Probably it's because I'm doing something really stupid and obvious that I just don't get because I don't have this kind of computer literacy.

item.title: Playing Own Server - Port Issue
item.dc:creator: @Dewey_Dell Dewey Dell
item.description:
@Dewey_Dell wrote:

I’m okay with just playing it offline. I did set the classpath and path.

Read full topic

item.title: Playing Own Server - Port Issue
item.dc:creator: @Skaternerd7 Skaternerd7
item.description:
@Skaternerd7 wrote:

are you talking about playing it online, or offline? if offline then you need to set your paths and classpaths. i’m not sure if you mean playing it online

Read full topic

item.description:
@Dewey_Dell wrote:

Yep I did both. I’m not sure if I portforwarded correctly though - what am I supposed to put in for the IP for the forwarded ports?

Read full topic

Have you portforwarded and made a No-ip DUC yet?
